intro: Poa serotina var. muralis, commonly known as wall grass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often found on walls, banks, and pathways. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with narrow, blade-like leaves that are usually blue-green in color. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each stem, which produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. This variant is adapted to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
